The episode sparked outrage across Kerala and led to heated discussions on the use of social media, the possible consequences of public shaming, and mental health. Mini Muringatheri reports on an episode that has divided society

content: He asks States to ensure timely appointment and training of Census functionaries, effective use of digital tools, and a focused publicity and communication approach

title: 71 fugitives located abroad in 2024-25, highest in 12 years
content: DoPT data shows only 27 fugitives returned to India in 2025; India has extradition treaties with 48 countries; as on March 31, 2025, there were 533 letters rogatory from India pending with other countries

content: A series of webinars will explore innovations in healthcare, agriculture, environment, and advanced manufacturing, while also addressing challenges such as sustainability, resilience, and inclusive growth

content: Officials identified the deceased terrorist as JeM commander Usman alias ‚ÄòAbu Maviya‚Äô. They said a large quantity of arms and ammunition, including an M4 automatic rifle, were recovered during the operation in a remote village in Parhetar area

content: This act of arson comes at a time when the city remains politically charged following the violent clash earlier this month

title: Transport stakeholders divided over bike taxi services after court order
content: While bike taxi riders welcomed the High Court‚Äôs order, auto-rickshaw unions and transport associations expressed concern over safety risks and the economic impact on thousands of families dependent on traditional transport services.

title: Ambitious scheme to spur next-gen battery manufacturing in India stumbles
content: Delays in visa approvals for Chinese technical specialists, requirements that mandate local manufacturing, and the lack of critical technologies threaten the government‚Äôs Advanced Chemistry Cell Production Linked Incentive scheme, says report

content: Team says no definitive agreement has been reached between ADB and the State government regarding the exact scope of the project or the terms and modalities of any potential funding

content: Chief Justice Manindra Mohan Shrivastava and Justice G. Arul Murugan dismiss a writ appeal filed against Justice V. Lakshminarayanan‚Äôs order

title: President inaugurates Granth Kutir at Rashtrapati Bhavan
content: Granth Kutir (book house) has a rich collection of manuscripts and books in 11 classical languages of India, including Tamil, Sanskrit, Kannada, Malayalam, Odia, Marathi, Pali, Prakrit, Assamese, and Bengali

content: Elaborate arrangements are being made for the grand event on a 22-acre parade ground, with an exclusive VIP gallery for the Amaravati farmers

content: Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma said the Centre‚Äôs proposal would add momentum to sacred journeys in the State

content: Directs him not to make any statement or comment regarding the criminal cases pending against him in any forum including print, electronic and social media

content: MP says he is the victim of a political witch hunt; Satheesan says photographs no proof of culpability in the case as projected by the LDF¬†

content: CPI(M) leaders, including General Education Minister V. Sivankutty, accuse the BJP of failing to deliver on its promises and stalling Kerala‚Äôs development by withholding funds.

title: CRDA allots 115 plots to Amaravati farmers through e-lottery
content: Plots with road cuts have not been allotted and no plot is located on lands not acquired from the farmers, say officials

title: Lorry owners urge A.P. govt. to put on hold vehicle tracking device norm
content: New vehicle registrations should be allowed without insisting on installation of a VLTD until the technical and other issues related to the devices are resolved, says Andhra Pradesh Lorry Owners' Association

title: Thousands in Bengal receive SIR notices over ‚Äòunusually high number‚Äô of children linked to electors
content: West Bengal Congress president Subhankar Sarkar flags ‚Äòarbitrary‚Äô threshold setting by the Election Commission and points out that the number of electors with six or more electors linked to them as children stood at 2,06,056, whereas, if the threshold is raised to 10, the number was only 8,682

content: He becomes the first accused in the high-profile case to be released from jail; bail granted to Babu under stringent conditions; remand period of senior Tantri extended to another 14 days

content: Chief Minister also seeks generous funding for renewable energy sector, noting that both the Centre and the State are prioritising investments, with DISCOMs providing counter-guarantees

content: With Assembly elections approaching, intention behind such false propaganda is character assassination and to influence voters for political gains, he says

title: Authorities deny ‚Äòsudden stoppage‚Äô of water from KC Canal
content: Farmers need to follow the Irrigation Advisory Board guidelines, they say, adding that the advisory against taking up rabi cultivation along the 0-150 km stretch of the canal after January 15 has been communicated in advance to the farmers

title: Jana Nayagan censor row: Madras High Court to pronounce verdict on January 27
content: Chief Justice Manindra Mohan Shrivastava and Justice G. Arul Murugan would be delivering the verdict they had reserved on January 20, 2026

title: No need to oppose influencers as long as purpose of journalism is not compromised: Barkha Dutt
content: Journalist Barkha Dutt received the 2025 Chavara Media Award for her lifetime contribution to journalism, instituted by the Department of Journalism, Sacred Heart College, Thevara

title: Integrated pharmacy counter opened at Government Medical College Hospital Thiruvananthapuram
content: The facility will cater to the medicine requirement of the beneficiaries of various health insurance schemes

title: Kharge, Rahul brainstorm with Cong. leaders from Kerala on Assembly poll strategy
content: Candidate selection, seat-sharing with allies, and building bridges with social organisations reportedly topped the agenda. Sunny Joseph, Satheesan, Chennithala, Adoor Prakash, M.M. Hassan among attendees

title: BJP agenda in Kerala is purely communal: Satheesan
content: Modi had nothing to say about developmental achievements, country‚Äôs future, or State‚Äôs priorities. Instead, he made only communal remarks, says Leader of the Opposition

title: Union Minister Pemmasani slams Jagan‚Äôs remarks on land resurvey
content: Refuting allegations of ‚Äòcredit theft‚Äô, the Union Minister says that the Centre withheld incentive funds pertaining to the exercise as the YSRCP government failed to submit required documents

title: ‚ÄòChina will eat them up‚Äô: Trump slams Canada over pushback on ‚ÄòGolden Dome‚Äô plan in Greenland
content: US President Donald Trump criticized Canada for opposing his "Golden Dome" missile defense system over Greenland, accusing Ottawa of prioritizing economic ties with China. Trump asserted Canada's security relies on the US, a claim rejected by Canadian PM Mark Carney, who emphasized Canadian sovereignty and thriving independently. The dispute highlights ongoing bilateral tensions and differing approaches to international relations.

title: Noida techie death: Non-bailable warrant against absconding Lotus Greens founder Nirmal Singh
content: A non-bailable warrant has been issued for Lotus Greens founder Nirmal Singh in connection with the drowning death of engineer Yuvraj Mehta. Singh is absconding, with police warning of property attachment if he doesn't surrender. He faces charges under environmental acts and BNS sections for negligence and public nuisance.

title: Still eyeing the Arctic? White House posts AI image of Trump with penguin in Greenland
content: President Trump is intensifying his focus on Greenland, with the White House releasing an AI-generated image of him with a penguin to highlight the strategic importance of the Arctic island. Trump has cited security concerns regarding Russia and China, sparking backlash from allies. He also criticized Canada's opposition to a missile defense project, warning of Chinese influence.

title: Revealed! Why Suryakumar Yadav was angry at Ishan Kishan
content: Suryakumar Yadav lauded Ishan Kishan's fearless batting after India's seven-wicket win over New Zealand.  Kishan's aggressive 76 and Yadav's 82 powered a remarkable chase, reflecting the team's desired free-flowing approach. Despite bowling struggles, the team restricted New Zealand to a manageable total.

title: Davos 2026: Musk, Trump reconcile at memorial; policy rift on US solar energy emerges
content: Elon Musk and Donald Trump have reportedly reconciled, attending a memorial together in September 2025.  Despite this apparent truce, Musk recently diverged from Trump's stance on energy at the World Economic Forum, advocating for solar power to meet America's growing electricity demands, a move contrasting with Trump's pro-oil policies.

title: Vimeo Layoffs: YouTube rival slashes global staff; move after $1.38bn deal
content: Video platform Vimeo is reportedly conducting significant global layoffs following its acquisition by Bending Spoons. This marks the second round of job cuts for Vimeo this year, impacting a large portion of its workforce. Former VP Dave Brown confirmed his departure, citing the sudden nature of the layoffs after the company's recent purchase.

title: 'Let's seize the moment': Von der Leyen sees EU-India FTA
content: EU Commission President Ursula von der Leyen anticipates a watershed moment for EU-India ties with a Free Trade Agreement and a new defence partnership expected from the upcoming summit.  She highlighted the potential for significant economic gains from the FTA and enhanced security cooperation in a volatile world.

title: 'Palash Muchhal was caught red-handed': Smriti Mandhana's childhood friend makes big claim
content: Actor-producer Vidnyan Mane has accused singer-composer Palaash Muchhal of infidelity and financial misconduct, leading to a police complaint in Sangli, Maharashtra. Mane alleges Muchhal was caught with another woman during wedding festivities and claims he was cheated of over Rs 40 lakh in a film project. Muchhal has denied all accusations, calling them baseless and factually incorrect.

title: Kamaal R Khan held after shots fired inside Andheri West residential complex
content: Actor Kamaal R Khan was arrested by Mumbai Police in connection with a firing incident at a housing society. Two bullets were reportedly fired, leaving impact marks but no casualties. Police are investigating the motive behind the event and have taken Khan into custody for interrogation.

title: Amazon layoffs: Firm to cut 14k more jobs; CEO says 'not about AI or cost cutting but‚Ä¶'
content: Amazon is planning to cut approximately 14,000 corporate jobs starting next week, marking the second major layoff wave since October and bringing total reductions to 30,000 roles. CEO Andy Jassy clarified the cuts aren't driven by AI or financial concerns but by excessive bureaucracy and organizational layers. The layoffs will affect employees across AWS, retail, Prime Video, and human resources divisions, representing nearly 10% of Amazon's corporate workforce.

title: Do alcohol-free ‚Äòonly weekend drinking‚Äô habits still damage the liver?
content: Weekend-only drinking, often perceived as responsible, can still significantly harm the liver. Experts emphasize that the amount and speed of alcohol consumption, rather than the number of alcohol-free days, are key factors in liver damage. This pattern can lead to silent, progressive liver disease, especially for those with pre-existing health conditions.

title: Budget 2026 metal sector expectations: MMTC-PAMP pushes for duty parity for refiners
content: India's precious metal refiners are urging the government to address duty disparities that disadvantage local operations compared to imported refined bullion. MMTC-PAMP highlights a mismatch in import duties, particularly through the SEPA route, impacting domestic refiners' competitiveness. The industry seeks policy support, including input-related benefits and wider duty differentials, to bolster India's refining capacity and global standing.

title: Delhi AQI at 256 in ‚Äòpoor‚Äô category; visibility improves, minimum temperatures to drop 5‚Äì6¬∞C over next 3 days
content: Delhi experienced clear skies on Saturday after Friday's heavy rainfall, bringing a slight improvement in air quality to the 'poor' category. Moderate fog and strong winds are expected, with minimum temperatures anticipated to fall by 5-6¬∞C over the next three days. Despite the rain, air quality remained poor across several city areas.

title: The question that brought Ishan Kishan back: 'Can I do it or not?'
content: Ishan Kishan's powerful 76 off 32 balls marked a triumphant return to the Indian jersey after a two-year hiatus.  He rediscovered his form through domestic cricket, answering his own doubts about his capability to perform at the international level.  Kishan's confident mindset and strategic approach were key to chasing a daunting target.

title: Blue room, broken wall: Clues from 10-year-old help nab rape accused
content: Abandoned slippers and a broken wall in a forested ridge led police to crack a sexual assault case involving a 10-year-old girl. Investigators identified a red e-rickshaw with a white roof from CCTV footage, ultimately leading to the arrest of the 25-year-old suspect, Durgesh.

title: 2nd-year BTech student jumps to death from 4th-floor hostel building in Greater Noida
content: A 20-year-old BTech student, Udit Soni, died after jumping from the fourth floor of EZ Stays hostel in Greater Noida. Police reported the incident occurred after the hostel manager scolded him for returning drunk. Authorities have taken custody of the body and are investigating the circumstances.

title: Josh Allen injury update: Bills QB faces uncertainty amid possible surgery concerns
content: Buffalo Bills General Manager Brandon Beane has provided an update about Josh Allen's injury. According to him, the star QB may undergo right-foot surgery. Furthermore, the Bills have faced a serious crisis on their offensive line. The star quarterback has injured himself in their last game against the Denver Broncos.

title: Reggie Miller says Stephen Curry should call Giannis as Father Time looms
content: Reggie Miller urged Stephen Curry to recruit Giannis Antetokounmpo to the Warriors, citing Milwaukee's struggles and the Warriors' need for star power after Jimmy Butler's injury. Miller believes this blockbuster move could save Curry's prime and reshape the league, combining two of the game's biggest stars for a championship push.

title: Ray Daniels sparks outrage with explosive LeBron‚ÄìKobe comparison
content: Music executive Ray Daniels faced widespread backlash with a controversial statement comparing LeBron James and Kobe Bryant, suggesting Bryant had a "daddy" while James did not. This personal remark, made on his podcast, shifted the debate from basketball to respect and boundaries, drawing sharp criticism from fans who deemed it unnecessary and attention-seeking.

title: Gym syndicate in UP targeted Hindu women for conversion; GRP head constable among 6 held
content: A Mirzapur gym syndicate was busted for an illegal religious conversion and AI-backed blackmail racket targeting up to 30 women. The gang created AI-generated obscene videos of Hindu women to coerce them into religious conversion and sexual exploitation. Six accused, including a police constable, have been arrested.

title: US braces for historic winter storm; power outage risks mount, flights cancelled
content: A colossal winter tempest is wreaking havoc across a significant portion of the United States, bringing with it an onslaught of freezing rain and subzero Arctic air. Meteorologists are alerting residents that the storm might cause devastation akin to hurricane-force conditions. With life-threatening wind chills becoming common, the risk of frostbite looms large.

title: Nick Castellanos‚Äô wife Jessica‚Äôs comment adds charm to Realmuto‚Äôs family moment
content: ‚Äã J.T. Realmuto and his wife, Alexis, had a relaxing family photo that instantly hit a chord with the fans. The image was shot in a relaxed setting on a peaceful beach background with soft and neutral color, which provided a feeling of comfort and unity between the family. As fans reacted warmly to the post, one comment stood out for its familiarity and humor. Nick Castellanos‚Äô wife, Jessica Castellanos, shared a response that blended affection with an easy sense of fun.

title: 'Border 2' box office collections Day 1: Sunny Deol starrer earns Rs 30 crore
content: 'Border 2' has made a powerful debut at the box office, exceeding expectations with an impressive Rs 30 crore net collection on its opening day. The war drama, starring Sunny Deol, secured a significant Rs 17 crore in advance bookings, positioning it among the highest first-day collections in Bollywood history.

title: 'Never looked at personal gain': Shinde praises Raj Thackeray for 'helping hand' in Kalyan-Dombivli
content: Deputy CM Eknath Shinde lauded MNS chief Raj Thackeray for his broader perspective and support for development, noting MNS corporators' backing in KDMC. Shinde emphasized the Mahayuti's strength, including the MNS, and stated the BMC mayor's post will be from their alliance, not for those lacking numbers.

title: ‚ÄòFailed to write 1 to 50‚Äô: Father beats child to death with rolling pin in Faridabad
content: A Faridabad father, Krishna Jaiswal, has been arrested for allegedly beating his four-and-a-half-year-old daughter to death with a rolling pin and slamming her on the floor. The brutal assault reportedly occurred because the child struggled with her numbers. The father initially tried to conceal the crime by claiming she fell.

title: 300 more killed, Telangana dog toll 900 in a month; sarpanch named in FIR
content: Approximately 300 dog carcasses were discovered in a pit in Jagtial district, Telangana, following alleged mass killings. Animal rights activists claim the incident occurred on Thursday, reportedly on the village sarpanch's orders. Police have registered an FIR against the sarpanch and gram panchayat secretary under relevant sections of the BNS and PCA Act.

title: ‚ÄòIt‚Äôs good Balasaheb isn‚Äôt here, he would have been distressed‚Äô: Raj Thackeray on Maharashtra‚Äôs current scenario
content: Thackeray cousins shared a stage, expressing dismay over Maharashtra's political 'auctions' and defections. Raj Thackeray called the situation 'disgusting,' while Uddhav Thackeray vowed to 'start afresh' after BMC polls, criticizing those trying to erase the 'Thackeray' name and alleging money played a role in elections. Both emphasized continuing Balasaheb's legacy.

title: T20 WC row: Bangladesh stare at major financial hit; set to lose millions of dollars
content: Bangladesh's cricket board faces a potential crisis as the national team might withdraw from the T20 World Cup over security and national prestige concerns. This decision, linked to BCB president Aminul Islam Bulbul, could cost the country millions in lost revenue and impact future tours. Players, while assured of match fees, miss a crucial global platform.

title: 'Chemical kitchen': South Delhi police uncover major synthetic narcotics lab
content: South district police arrested a Nigerian national, Emmanuel, allegedly a kingpin in a synthetic drug operation. A "chemical kitchen" was discovered in his Devli residence, a factory for manufacturing high-end psychotropic substances like MDMA and heroin. The bust yielded 113 kg of raw materials, indicating local production and potential international cartel links.

title: FIR filed against 5 minor girls for allegedly making Hindu friend wear burqa
content: An FIR has been registered in Moradabad against five minor Muslim girls. They are accused of making their 16-year-old Hindu friend wear a burqa. The incident occurred on December 12, 2025. Police are investigating the matter following a complaint. The law carries a severe punishment for religious conversion by force or fraud.

title: When teams said no: A look at ICC tournaments hit by refusals and withdrawals
content: Teams withdrawing from ICC events due to security and political concerns is a recurring issue. Notable instances include Australia and West Indies in 1996, England and New Zealand in 2003, Zimbabwe in 2009, Australia in 2016, and India's refusal to tour Pakistan in 2025. These decisions have significantly impacted major tournaments.

title: Bangladesh does not deserve a govt aligned with radicals, says Sheikh Hasina
content: Tarique Rahman's return as BNP chairman is viewed critically, citing his exile and alleged corruption. The article questions the legitimacy of upcoming elections due to the ban on the Awami League, attributing it to fear of their popularity. It also highlights the government's failure to protect minorities and its appeasement of extremist forces, impacting India-Bangladesh relations.

title: Risk of PM, CM removal bill being misused: Legal experts
content: A proposed anti-corruption bill faces criticism from legal experts who warn that linking the removal of PMs, CMs, or ministers to 30 days of arrest on serious charges could be politically misused. Concerns were raised that this provision might override popular will, with some suggesting "framing of charges" as a more appropriate threshold for removal.

title: Telangana: 300 dog carcasses found dumped in Jagtial; mass killing toll rises to 900
content: Over 300 dog carcasses were discovered in a pit in Jagtial district, Telangana, following alleged mass killings. This incident brings the total number of deceased dogs in the state this month to nearly 900. Animal rights activists claim the killings were ordered by the village sarpanch, leading to an FIR against local officials.

title: 'Dhurandhar' crashes on day 50 after 'Border 2' release
content: 'Dhurandhar' marks 50 days at the box office, but with its lowest collection yet at Rs 55 lakh. Despite a strong run, the film's earnings dipped significantly in its eighth week. While its total net earnings are Rs 831.5 crore, it faces stiff competition, with 'Border 2' now posing a challenge.

title: IND vs NZ: Surya, Ishan crush New Zealand as India go 2-0 up in T20I series
content: India surged to a commanding 2-0 lead in the T20 series against New Zealand, securing a seven-wicket victory in Raipur. Ishan Kishan's explosive 76 and Suryakumar Yadav's unbeaten 82 powered the chase, while Kuldeep Yadav's two wickets proved crucial in restricting the visitors.  The hosts comfortably overhauled New Zealand's 208-run target.

title: Adjourn West Bengal SIR hearing, file FIR if attacked: CEO
content: West Bengal's Chief Electoral Officer has directed district officials to immediately file FIRs against any destruction of public property or attacks on staff during SIR-related hearings. Hearings will be adjourned if violence persists, requiring CEO approval to resume. This directive follows an incident in Murshidabad where an MLA was not named in an FIR despite alleged vandalism and hate speech.

title: Upset over Rahul 'snub', Tharoor skips poll meet with Cong brass, goes for lit fest instead
content: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor missed a crucial Kerala leadership meeting, reportedly due to a perceived snub from Rahul Gandhi. While the party strategizes for the 2026 state polls and mends ties with allies, Tharoor's absence fuels speculation about his standing. Party leaders deny any internal discord, emphasizing unity for upcoming elections.

title: Countdown has begun for exit of DMK govt, time has come for NDA govt: Narendra Modi
content: Modi said TN needed an NDA dispensation that would work in tandem with Centre to accelerate development and attract investments.

title: Markets crash: Investors lost over Rs 16 lakh cr this week; what caused the bloodbath?
content: Stock market crash: Sensex and Nifty have fallen nearly 1% on Friday amid broad-based selling, a record-low rupee and persistent foreign outflows, dragging market sentiment despite supportive global cues.

title: Trump tariffs, falling rupee: Key risks to India's growth story; can the Budget protect it?
content: In the backdrop of Donald Trump's tariff threats, uncertainty over India-US trade deal and rising geopolitical tensions, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman‚Äôs Union Budget 2026 assumes significance. What are the risks to India‚Äôs robust and resilient growth story, and what can Budget 2026 do to mitigate them? We ask economists:

title: Snow & winds bring chaos to J&K: Roads blocked, flights paused, power hit, schools shut
content: Jammu and Kashmir was battered by heavy snowfall and fierce winds reaching 155kmph, causing widespread disruption. Highways were blocked, flights cancelled, schools shut, and power supply severely impacted. The Vaishno Devi pilgrimage was suspended as snow blanketed the Trikuta Hills. Authorities are bracing for further weather challenges.

title: Trump Joins 'Penguin Meme' Trend With Cryptic Post On Greenland
content: The United States has once again turned its attention to Greenland, this time not through official statements but through a viral meme.

title: Girl, 10, Raped In Delhi, Left In Forest Area By E-Rickshaw Driver: Cops
content: A 10-year-old girl, selling roses at traffic signals in central Delhi, was allegedly kidnapped, raped and left unconscious in a forest area by an e-rickshaw driver, police said on Thursday.

title: In Madhya Pradesh's Bhojshala, A 'Dummy Namaz' Claim Amid Peaceful Prayers
content: Allegations of a "dummy namaz" have cast a fresh shadow over what the administration is calling a rare and hard-won moment of communal calm in Dhar.

title: Vehicles Burnt, Stones Thrown In Madhya Pradesh After Attack On VHP Leader
content: An attack on a young Vishwa Hindu Parishad (VHP) leader snowballed into intense communal violence in Tarana town of Madhya Pradesh's Ujjain district, leading to large-scale vandalism, arson and a heavy police crackdown over two days.

title: Actor Kamaal R Khan Arrested For Firing At Residential Building In Mumbai
content: Actor Kamaal Rashid Khan, popularly known as KRK, has now been arrested by the Mumbai police in connection with a two-round firing case in Mumbai. He was the prime suspect in the case.

title: Suspected Russia 'Shadow Fleet' Tanker Bound For French Port
content: A tanker suspected of being part of Russia's sanctions-busting "shadow fleet" will be escorted to the French port of Marseille-Fos, sources close to the case said Friday, a day after the navy intercepted it.

title: Italy's Meloni Hopes To Nominate Trump For Nobel Peace Prize
content: Italian leader Giorgia Meloni said Friday she hoped US President Donald Trump would end the conflict in Ukraine so she could nominate him for the Nobel Peace Prize.

title: Empty Supermarket Shelves, Flights Cancelled: US Gears Up For Heavy Snow Storm
content: Americans stripped supermarket shelves Friday ahead of potentially "catastrophic" winter weather that threatened at least 160 million people across the country with transportation chaos, blackouts and life-threatening cold.

title: No Maintenance If Wife Contributes To Husband's Incapacity To Earn: Court
content: If a wife's actions or omissions contribute to her husband's incapacity to earn, she cannot claim maintenance from him, the Allahabad High Court has held.

title: "China Will Eat Them Up": Trump Blasts Canada Over Greenland Golden Dome
content: US President Donald Trump on Friday slammed Canada for rejecting his proposed "Golden Dome" missile defence project over Greenland, warning that Beijing could "eat them up" within a year as the northern neighbour chooses closer ties with China.

title: 1st Commercial Semiconductor Chip Production Will Begin This Year: Minister
content: Union Electronics and Information Technology Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw on Friday said India is on track to begin commercial semiconductor chip production in 2026, meeting the timeline set under India Semiconductor Mission launched in January 2022.

title: Iran Never Wanted To Have Nuclear Weapons, It's "Haram": Khamenei Aide
content: Iran never wanted to have nuclear weapons, because "it is haram", Dr Abdul Majid Hakeem Ilahi, Representative in India of Iran's Supreme Leader, has said, while stating that the country wants to use nuclear energy for peaceful purposes.

title: "Insulting": UK PM Slams Trump's Comments On NATO Troops In Afghanistan
content: UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer Friday denounced as "insulting" Donald Trump's claim that troops from NATO allies avoided the front line in Afghanistan, as anger grows at the US president's remarks.

title: Five Women Among 17 Maoists Killed In Jharkhand
content: A high-ranking Central Committee member of the CPI (Maoist), identified as Patiram Majhi alias Anal da, was shot on Thursday during a major joint anti-Naxal operation, Meghaburu.

title: Video: US Kills Two "Narco-Terrorists" In Eastern Pacific Boat Strike
content: The US Southern Command said on Friday it carried out a strike on a vessel in the eastern Pacific, killing two people.

title: Russian, Ukrainian, US Negotiators Meet In Abu Dhabi For Peace Talks
content: Negotiators from Russia, Ukraine and the United States met Friday in Abu Dhabi for the first direct negotiations on a plan being pushed by US President Donald Trump to end the almost four-year-long war.

title: Massive Fire Breaks Out At Gaming Zone In Udaipur, Property Damage Reported
content: A massive fire broke out at a gaming zone under the Sukher police station in Udaipur city on Friday afternoon, causing severe damage to the premises, though no loss of life was reported from the site.

title: 5 Killed, 10 Injured In Suicide Blast At Wedding In Pakistan
content: At least five people were killed and ten injured in a suicide blast during wedding celebrations at the residence of a peace committee member in Pakistan's northwestern Khyber Pakhtunkhwa province on Friday night.

title: Shubhanshu Shukla Among 5 To Receive 'Uttar Pradesh Gaurav Samman'
content: Uttar Pradesh government will honour five distinguished luminaries, including Wing Commander Shubhanshu Shukla, who have brought laurels to the state at the national and international level.

title: 24-Year-Old Man Shot Dead At Cafe In Delhi: Cops
content: A 24-year-old man was shot dead by unidentified assailants at a cafe in northeast Delhi's Maujpur area late Friday night, police said.

title: Expert picks: 'The Highlight' is a bad matchup for 'The Baddy'
content: a matchup between lightweight fan favorites will headline the first fight card since Dec. 13 . paddy Pimblett, ESPN's no. 7-ranked lightweight, is undefeated in the UFC . his last win was a third-round knockout of Michael Chandler .

title: Rose-themed concession items planned for Derrick Rose's jersey retirement
content: the "Rose Cocktail" is a clarified margarita with reposado tequila . the drink includes a rose-infused ice cube with a red rose inside . there's an MVP burger and fries plus no. 1 nachos .

title: KD, rising guards and bully ball: Inside the Rockets' Texas-sized offense
content: the Houston Rockets lost 20-point to the defending champions . they would close out the worst seven-game stretch of 3-point shooting in history . not even 24-year-olds were shot in the first half of the game .

title: Seahawks' Darnold good to go for NFC title game
content: sam darnold and his injured oblique are good to go for the NFC title game . he was limited in practice all three days this week as part of the team's plan to get him ready to play Sunday against the los Angeles Rams at Lumen Field . "i feel really good," he said Friday .

title: Who should've made the top 10? What were the biggest surprises?
content: the college football top 100 player rank list from the 2025-26 season is here . the real question is, did our selection committee get it right? were there any players who should've made the list but didn't?

title: 8 years, 5 schools and a career-threatening condition: The story of Tyon Grant-Foster
content: Tyon Grant-Foster won a game-saving block on the perimeter to force overtime . the 6-foot-7 forward helped the Bulldogs claw back in the second half . he will have suited up for five different schools by the time he turns 26 in march .

title: Who wins the 2026 national title? We predict the CFP bracket
content: a 12-team playoff has turned out to be a lot of fun, but we stick with 12 for a while longer . if we simply used Schlabach's rankings for this exercise, we'd be looking at a field resembling this . it's time for the next step in the predictions process: let's talk about who will make the college football playoff .

title: Why feds call Olympic snowboarder a 'modern-day Pablo Escobar'
content: Ryan Wedding, 44, and his associates allegedly trafficked more than $1 billion in cocaine across the u.s. and Canada . prosecutors laid out how wedding allegedly orchestrated multiple killings, including the assassination of a key government witness . wedding was born into a snow sports family .

title: Death of one-year-old boy: police arrest father
content: first day first show news and reviews from the world of cinema and streaming . the weekly newsletter from science writers takes the jargon out of science and puts the fun in . police arrest the father of a one-year-old boy who died under suspicious circumstances earlier this month in Neyyatti .

title: Sources: OT Seaton joining LSU, leaves Colorado
content: OT Seaton is the top offensive tackle and no. 4 overall player in ESPN's transfer rankings . the 6-foot-5, 330-pound sophomore was one of the highest-rated signees in Colorado program history as a five-star recruit in the 2024 class .
